page.title: 14COMMUNICATION
page.content: In this rural community, most people have a telephone to maintain contact with friends and relatives. A local newspaper, The Cotswold Standard, published weekly, is redily available. Broadwell Post Office was previously situated in a private house, the village shop and the Fox Inn. The present Post Office was originally the bottling store of the 300 year old Quinmoor Farm. It is open 4 days a week for stamps, postal orders, pensions, sweets and cards as well as chutneys and marmalades made by villagers. Oddington Post Office has been providing its service for 150 years. It is open 5 days a week with Thursday being very busy as many elderly people collect their pensions then. Both Post Offices have one delivery and two collections per day.
